conclusion: To determine the car's acceleration from the x-t graph, analyze the slope which represents velocity.
The graph shows a straight line with a positive slope.
At t = 0 s, the position (x) is 10 m.
At t = 2 s, the position (x) is 0 m.
Calculate the slope (velocity) using change in position over change in time.
The slope m = (0 m - 10 m) / (2 s - 0 s) = -5 m/s.
The velocity of the car is -5 m/s.
Since the graph is a straight line, the velocity is constant.
The acceleration is the rate of change of velocity with respect to time. If velocity is constant, acceleration is zero.
The car's acceleration from the start of timing is 0 m/sÂ².
